turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of the San Francisco Giants.
turn.2: In the bottom of the fifth at home against the [[2007 Washington Nationals season|Washington Nationals]] on August 7, Bonds hit number 756 into the center field bleachers, causing a melee in the crowd scrambling for the ball, which later earned six figures at auction for the young man who came up with it.
turn.4: Aaron, appearing on the big screen, congratulated him personally.
turn.6: The 2007 season continued discouraging for the Giants, with solid pitching but often without run support.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Rookie starter [[Tim Lincecum]], for instance, held the [[Chicago Cubs]] to two hits through eight innings on August 21, but the team scored only one run in a 5–1 loss.
turn.10: On September 22, 2007, the Giants officially announced they would not re-sign Bonds for the 2008 season.
turn.12: After much speculation and debate, owner [[Peter Magowan]] announced Bonds' departure at a press conference, stressing the need for youth and offense throughout the lineup. Bonds played the last game of his career on September 26, 2007.
